content.description: Boomer Self Defense is a short boulder problem that starts with two hand jams in the horizontal crack on the West face of the Boomer Jorts boulder. Once the jams are set use the high crimp to bump for the sloped top out.A good warm up problem, might be harder for some climbers depending on hand size as the jamming spots are a little narrow.
content.location: Park at Juji Fruit. Scramble downhill 50’. Turn south and you’ll be a Jorts in 5-10 seconds.

content.description: Boomer Self Actualization is a traverse across the South face of the Jorts boulder. Start on the left and move right without using the top edge of the boulder topping out on the right with good holds.
content.location: Park at Juji Fruit. Scramble downhill 50’. Turn south and you’ll be a Jorts in 5-10 seconds.

content.description:
Jorts is a stone’s throw from Pullout Game parking. Stand on the ramp at the parking and look WSW. About 50’ below you sits a squarish boulder with a horizontal seam running along its north side - this is Jorts. 

  Boomer Self Defense waits on the west face. Boomer Self Actualization on the south.
